result.execSummary:
Richard Gregory Harasyn was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Richard Gregory Harasyn was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Gregory Harasyn

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: SRN and Defendant signed this date. eif

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA: Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton,  DF:  Richard Gregory Harasyn appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Court notes Defendant has a felony warrant out of Washington County MN. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands. Defendant wishes to waive extradition. Court questions Defendant and is sworn. Both parties sign waiver. Defendant to be held without bond until picked up from Minnesota.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
